title: Manager shorts pay and tries to get employee to quit, instead unknowingly saves him $18k and employed for 6 years: ‘I don’t steal from employers, unless they steal from me first.’
description: Oh if only Reddit were around during the days of Johnny Cash. There would be even MORE work-related drama stories on there that are probably even MORE unbelievable. But, then again, would they be able to get away with as much as they did back then if the internet existed? Probably not. Definitely not. But, for now, we have Reddit and the satisfying stories of employees defying their greedy bosses to keep us happy. Take, for instance, this guy whose manager tried to short his paycheck! He hired him with three weeks paid vacation immediately, which is unheard of in the U.S. (I know, sux). So he was stoked, but it was obvious the boss thought he was just going to quit, or it would be easy to get him to want to quit, after his job was done before ever having to cash out on those paid days off. Oh, boy, was he wrong. He messed with the wrong employee…
author: Elna McHilderson

title: Contractor disrespect his small community, locals happily give him a dose of his own medicine: ‘Heck, one of the FB groups "[Loser] of Our Town" made him their profile picture'
description: The library is specifically built as a place for quiet. It's so people can read, study, or even just relax. It's rows and rows of books filled with knowledge and adventure are only accessible if you are in the right headspace to soak it all in. If you are there and someone is screaming into their phone about the woes of reality right next to you as you're trying to hallucinate through scribbles on some processed lumber, it's going to be very difficult. It's not easy to be transported to the wide open sea on a pirate ship or retain the facts about the human anatomy in the middle of a library if someone is next to you being noisy. That's why librarians and library attendees are constantly shushing everyone around them.  So what do you do when some tough guy entitled dude waltzing into your quiet space yelling and refusing to quiet down? This guy trying to study came up with a plan!
author: Elna McHilderson

title: Heartless strangers abandon cat in hotel lobby, but the wholesome guests rally together to save the poor kitty and find them a heartwarming home (Video)
description: One of the things that we love most about cats, feline fam, is that they can really bring people together. We all live so much in our own worlds nowadays that it can be difficult to connect with others. However, cats are the great barrier-breakers - and this video proves it. One unsuspecting guest at a hotel was shocked to find an unaccompanied cat carrier just sitting in their hotel lobby. No pawrents around or anyone to claim the poor cat, so they started asking around. Unfortunately, they didn't have much luck and found out that the cat was abandoned there.Other guests helped them in their search, and one even offered to let it stay with them for the night while its future was being decided. Long story short, the kitty is now off to its furrever home, thanks to these wholesome hotel guests who rallied together to save this poor, scared cat. Scroll down to watch the video and read all the ameowzing comments below!
author: Blake Seidel

title: 23 Cat Memes Coming Like Knights in Shining Armor to Save You From Sadness
description: What would we ever do without cats in our lives? It's hard to answer that question, mainly because we don't want to even think of the possibility of not having cats in our lives. When we think about this we get anxious, so we simply prefer to not think about this possibility ever and go to cuddle our cute cat immediately. Because how's that even possible to comprehend a life without a cat in it? We want to always have cats in our lives, in every moment. We're sure that every cat pawrent feels the same way about their fluffy feline friends.We don't want you either to think of this depressing state of not having cats in your life. On the contrary - we want you to have as many cats as you want in your life! Now, we cannot, unfortunately, bring you a cat right to your doorstep - but we can definitely increase the amount of wholesome cat memes you look at. We gathered some of the cutest cat memes for this exact reason, so, enjoy!
author: Ayala Sorotsky

title: You've Got A Fast Car
description: Steam must have this motherfucker dialed in. Gabe is obsessed with self-published indie weirdness in fiction, and discovered tons of hot shit before it got optioned and made into movies. No doubt his predilection toward pervert horseshit has steered his algo to wash up all manner of strange treasure upon his shore, and the latest is the one he was just telling you about a couple days ago - Supercar Collection Simulator. One of this new wave of retail management games, this one has twisted incentives; it is a tour through the coal-black aorta of Capitalism itself. .

title: Error'd: Hot Dog
description: Faithful Peter G. took a trip. "So I wanted to top up my bus ticket online. After asking for credit card details, PINs, passwords, a blood sample, and the airspeed velocity of an unladen European swallow, they also sent a notification to my phone which I had to authorise with a fingerprint, and then verify that all the details were correct (because you can never be too careful when paying for a bus ticket). So yes, it's me, but the details definitely are not correct." Which part is wrong, the currency? Any idea what the exchange rate is between NZD and the euro right now?   An anonymous member kvetched "Apparently, I'm a genius, but The New York Times' Spelling Bee is definitely not."   Mickey D. Had an ad pop up for a new NAS to market. Specs: Check Storage: Check Superior technical support: "   Michael R. doesn't believe everything he sees on TV, thankfully, because "No wonder the stock market is in turmoil when prices fall by 500% like in the latest Amazon movie G20."   Finally, new friend Sandro shared his tale of woe. "Romance was hard enough I was young, and I see not much has changed now!"   [Advertisement] Plan Your .NET 9 Migration with ConfidenceYour journey to .NET 9 is more than just one decision.Avoid migration migraines with the advice in this free guide. Download Free Guide Now!
author: Lyle Seaman

title: CodeSOD: Static State
description: Today's Anonymous submitter was reviewing some C++ code, and saw this perfectly reasonable looking pattern. class SomeClass { public: void setField(int val); int getField(); } Now, we can talk about how overuse of getters and setters is itself an antipattern (especially if they're trivial- you've just made a public variable with extra steps), but it's not wrong and there are certainly good reasons to be cautious with encapsulation. That said, because this is C++, that getField should really be declared int getField() const- appropriate for any method which doesn't cause a mutation to a class instance. Or should it? Let's look at the implementation. void SomeClass::setField(int val) { setGetField(true, val); } void SomeClass::getField() { return setGetField(false); } Wait, what? Why are we passing a boolean to a method called setGet. Why is there a method called setGet? They didn't go and make a method that both sets and gets, and decide which they're doing based on a boolean flag, did they? int SomeClass::setGetField(bool set, int val) { static int s_val = 0; if (set) { s_val = val; } return s_val; } Oh, good, they didn't just make a function that maybe sets or gets based on a boolean flag. They also made the state within that function a static field. And yes, function level statics are not scoped to an instance, so this is shared across all instances of the class. So it's not encapsulated at all, and we've blundered back into Singletons again, somehow. Our anonymous submitter had two reactions. Upon seeing this the first time, they wondered: "WTF? This must be some kind of joke. I'm being pranked." But then they saw the pattern again. And again. After seeing it fifty times, they wondered: "WTF? Who hired these developers? And can that hiring manager be fired? Out of a cannon? Into the sun?" [Advertisement] Picking up NuGet is easy. Getting good at it takes time. Download our guide to learn the best practice of NuGet for the Enterprise.
author: Remy Porter

title: 4 Men Caught Smuggling Hundreds Of Ants
description: Four ant smugglers pleaded guilty after being caught by the Kenyan Wildlife Service attempting to sneak hundreds of giant African harvester ants out of the country, which are valued by some exotic animal dealers at over $200 each. title: Pros And Cons Of Bringing Back Extinct Species
description: Colossal Biosciences claims it has brought back the dire wolf, a species that went extinct thousands of years ago, by editing the genes of gray wolves. The Onion examines the pros and cons of resurrecting extinct species. title: The Replacement Plan
description: “We had a professional family photo done for my parents Mother’s & Father’s Day but right after we gave it to them, my brother got a divorce. title: A happy cry
description: Y’all. I’ve been a bit of a wreck lately and part of that is another bout of pernicious anemia (which absolutely sounds like a Lemony Snicket disease) and also some other autoimmune disease (BECAUSE I GUESS I DON’T HAVE ENOUGH?) that I haven’t been able to get tested for because the doctor says I’m tooContinue reading "A happy cry"
